greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A permutation of the natural numbers where a(n) = n XOR [n/2] XOR [n/4].
comment: Related to Gray code numbers (A003188) since A003188(n) = n XOR [n/2].
Inverse: A100280; A100281(n) = a(a(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 11 2004
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8191
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: XOR BINOMIAL transform begins: B={1, 2, 3, 7, 7, 0, 0, 14, 14, 0, 0, ...} and continues with B(2^k)=B(2^k+1)=7*2^(k-2) (for k>=2) and zeros elsewhere.
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Nov 09 2004
